verses.verse: {Job Laments and Prepares for Death} d "My spirit is crushed, my days are over; {Lit. extinguished} it's the grave for me!
Mockers surround me; I cannot stop staring at their hostility all through the night.
Offer, then, some collateral on my behalf. Is there anyone who will be my guarantor?
"Because you're the one who closed their hearts to compassion; {Lit. understanding} therefore, you won't let them triumph.
Now as for the one who testifies against his friends to take their property, {Or inheritance} even the eyes of his children will fail.
"He has made me a byword among people; I'm being spit on in the face.
My eyes have grown weak from grief; and my whole body is as thin as a shadow.
The upright are appalled over this, and the innocent person is troubled by the godless.
But the righteous person will hold to his way, and those with clean hands will grow stronger and stronger."
{Job Prepares for Death} d "Come here now, all of you, and I won't find a wise person among you.
My days are passed; my plans have been shattered; along with my heart's desires.
They have transformed night into day «The light,'they say, «is about to become dark.'
"If my hope were that my house is the afterlife {Lit. Sheol ; i. e. the realm of the afterlife} itself, if I were to make my bed in darkness,
if I call out to the Pit, {I. e. the realm of punishment in the afterlife} «You're my father!'or say to the worm, {I. e. an agent of punishment in the afterlife} «My mother!'or «My sister!'
where would my hope be? "And speaking of my hope, who would notice it?
Will it go down to the bars that lock the doors {The Heb. lacks that lock the doors} of the afterlife? {Lit. Sheol ; i. e. the realm of the dead} Will we descend together into the dust?"
